definition: variant of 煙斗|烟斗[yan1 dou3]
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: The Congo people decorate their pipes with figural and geometric patterns.
sentences.chinese: 剛果人民用幾和形狀的樣式裝飾他們的菸斗。

sentences.english: So he sat down on the floor, and lit a pipe which I gave him.
sentences.chinese: 他坐地上之後點着了我遞過去的菸斗。

sentences.english: The pipe lighted; smoke belched forth.
sentences.chinese: 菸斗點着了，煙霧冒了出來。

sentences.english: He tapped his pipe out into the fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 他把菸斗的菸灰敲到壁爐裏。

sentences.english: Thirsty?" Grampy asked, never removing the pipe from his mouth."
sentences.chinese: “渴嗎？”祖父菸斗不離口地問我。

sentences.english: Dupin filled his pipe with tobacco and lit it.
sentences.chinese: 杜平充滿菸草菸斗，把它點燃。

sentences.english: He tamped down the tobacco in(to) his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 他把菸絲緊緊塞實在菸斗內。

sentences.english: The old man tamped down some more tobacco into his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 老人又把一些菸絲摁進菸斗。

sentences.english: Philpott tamped a wad of tobacco into his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 菲爾波特往菸斗裏塞了一卷碎菸葉。

sentences.english: He had a pipe in his mouth and was smoking.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴裏銜一個菸斗，正吸着煙。

sentences.english: Before he could attempt to recover it, it was broken, and behind the fire.
sentences.chinese: 在他想奪回來以前，菸斗已經摺斷，扔在火裏了。

sentences.english: Brothers tobacco pipe, this is on the drum tower avenue a multi-faceted shop.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟菸斗，這是鼓樓大街上頗具特色的一家小店。

sentences.english: Why didn’t you preserve your father’s skill and make pipes?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你沒有繼承你父親的手藝，做菸斗？

sentences.english: Mr May always has a pipe in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 梅先生嘴裏總是叼着個菸斗。

sentences.english: He tamped down the tobacco in his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 他把菸絲緊塞在菸斗裏。

sentences.english: He shivered, and cupped his hands to light his pipe.
sentences.chinese: 他打了個冷激靈，抖索着用手擋住菸斗，點燃了菸斗。

definition: sorption (generic term for absorption, adsorption, diffusion, precipitation etc)
citrine (orange or yellow quartz SiO2 as a semiprecious stone)
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
